titleStmt.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the second half of the year (fols. 2ra-173vb) I-1) Maggābit (fols. 2ra–26vc) I-2) Miyāzyā (fols. 27ra–48rc) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 49ra–78rc) I-4) Sane (fols. 78ra–107rc) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 108ra–142va) I-6) Naḥāse (fols. 143ra–168vc) I-7) Ṗagʷǝmen (fols. 168vc–173rb) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additio 1.

msItem.note: For the first half of the Sǝnkǝssar see Ms.QS-013.
The prologue of the Synaxarion is separated from the main text with chains of red and black dots.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 173.0 folios, of which blank 1v, 48v, 107v, in 22.0 quires .
340 300 95
supportDesc.condition: The Ms. was crudely rebound. An additional leather cover has been added. Some fols. are stained with water (esp. at the beginning and at the end of the Ms.). Some passages and words are difficult to read due to faded ink (e.g., 10rc, 11rc, 16v, 27rc). Some fols. are slightly affected by mould along the fold (e.g., 64v/65r, 72v/73r, 81r, 166v/167r). Holes and tears carefully amended on 20, 31, 59, 62, 71, 78, 79, 84, 86, 107, 113, 117, 130, 138, 156, 159. 107 is mutilated, 1/3 of column c is cut off. 173 is mutilated, 1/2 of the leaf is cut off.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: It is difficult to determine whether more than one scribe was involved in writing. Certain features of some letters appear different throughout the Ms., cp. e.g., fols. 7 or 45 with 98 or 118; in the second part of the Ms. ል has got a long top end, አ and its derivations have a lack of connection between the main shift and the limb; the vowel marker of ሎ is placed close to the top of the letter.
The handwriting is very similar but not identical to the hand of QS-013 and of the Synaxarion from the church of ʿArbaʿtu Ǝnsäsa, ʿArabay Tämben.

item.desc: : Za-ʾaqrabku māḥleta… “The song I am offering…” (concluding prayer).

list.item: - The prologue of the Synaxarion is separated from the main text by chains of red and black dots. - The name of the original donor ዘመለኮት is replaced with ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ in a different hand (most probaly the same hand as in Ms. QS-013); mostly the first letters መዘ of the name of the original donor were not erased; occasionally the name of the original donor is only erased and not re-written (e.g., 14va, 18vc, 21ra, 32va, 50rb, 79vb, 101vc, 107ra, 130rc, 143vc); in 140vc part of the name of the original donor ዘመለኮ is still preserved; on 163r–157rc and 159vc–166rb the name of the original donor (Za-Mäläkot) in red ink was overwritten with Za-Manfas-Qǝddus in black ink. - Corrections over erased words and passages written probably in a different hand: e.g., 45vbc, 46rb, 70vab, 84rc, 89vc, 92ra, 109va, 110rbc, 135rb, 138rc, 158rc. - Some passages or words were blotted out: 102rc, 123vac, 126vc, 129va, 138va, 141vc, 156vb, 165vb. - Erasures marked with crossing or parallel lines: e.g., 38rc, 47vc, 49va, 50rc, 55vb, 57vac, 61vc, 70vb, 84vc, 89vc, 105rc, 158ra. - Erasures without marking: e.g., 3rac, 7vb, 20rb, 23rb, 24ra, 43rc, 103ra, 108ra. - ʿArke-hymn, on 148v, probably complementing the first commemoration on 7 Naḥāse (Annunciation) in a crude hand, in black ink of different tone. - Crude note in Gǝʿǝz (ሰለም፡ ለማኅበረ፡ ጽዮን...) and doodles in recent hands, in ballpoint pen: 1r. - Crude letters in pen or pencil: e.g., 116v, 159r. - Writing exercises: 97v, 102r, 105r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with deep rose tooled leather (remains of probably original, dark brown tooled leather cover are preserved on the inner side of both boards). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Endbands are made of rolled or folded strips of leather (not the usual slit-braid endband).

Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover is poorly visible. Blind tooled ornament on the deep rose leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double circle, triple line fillet, small x, double crescent with eye, criss-cross).

origin.origDate: Second half of or the late 18th cent.(?) The replacement of the name of the original donor with that of Za-Manfas Qǝddus/daǧǧāzmāč Subagadis (1770-1831) hints that the Ms. was written at least in the late 18th cent.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donor is most probably Za-Mäläkot (s. 140vc); it was later erased and replaced with the name of Za-Manfas Qǝddus mentioned in supplication formulas. Za-Manfas Qǝddus is the baptismal name of daǧǧāzmāč Subagadis (1770-1831). The names Walda Lǝʿul and Walatta Ṣǝyon are written over erased words on 35va.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
